description: Applies one or more tags to the specified resources. Note the following: In addition to the tag:TagResources permission required by this operation, you must also have the tagging permission defined by the service that created the resource. For example, to tag an Amazon EC2 instance using the TagResources operation, you must have both of the following permissions:

parameters.name: ResourceARNList
parameters.description: Specifies the list of ARNs of the resources that you want to apply tags to. An ARN (Amazon Resource Name) uniquely identifies a resource. For more information, see Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and Amazon Web Services Service Namespaces in the Amazon Web Services General Reference. (string) ---

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: Specifies a list of tags that you want to add to the specified resources. A tag consists of a key and a value that you define. (string) --- (string) ---

nested_items.name: FailedResourcesMap
nested_items.description: A map containing a key-value pair for each failed item that couldn't be tagged. The key is the ARN of the failed resource. The value is a FailureInfo object that contains an error code, a status code, and an error message. If there are no errors, the FailedResourcesMap is empty.
